paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Thr139Met, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Here, 0.79% of children were heterozygous for the Thr139Met substitution, which is positively associated with FT4 (B=1.70, s.e.=0.17, 95% CI 1.37, 2.03, P=3.89 × 10−24).
Here, 0.79% of children were heterozygous for the Thr139Met substitution, which is positively associated with FT4 (B=1.70, s.e.=0.17, 95% CI 1.37, 2.03, P=3.89 × 10−24).

functional_data.summary: The Thr139Met substitution appears to be functional: this mutation has increased protein stability compared with wild-type transthyretin and tighter binding of thyroxine, resulting in a twofold increase in thyroxine-binding affinity.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with the phenotype in the studied population.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on association with FT4 levels
variants.additional_notes: The variant was not originally observed as the MAF was lower than the 1% threshold.
key_quotes: The Thr139Met substitution was associated with FT4 levels in our single-point meta-analysis (P=2.14 × 10−11).
Here, 0.79% of children were heterozygous for the Thr139Met substitution, which is positively associated with FT4.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
